block.l: Click the numbers or the parrot.

custom-block.l: This is a demo of speech synthesis.
custom-block.comment: Some browsers will ignore this if the user hasn't clicked on the green flag.
Click this to change the language used.

custom-block.s: Open this in a new tab
Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
speak with random settings %txt and then %cmdRing

block.l: Click me again to say something else

custom-block.s: speak with random settings %txt and then %cmdRing

block.l: I didn't hear anything. Click me again.

custom-block.s: speak with random settings %txt and then %cmdRing

block.l: Click me again to hear another number.

block-definition.s: speak with random settings %'message' and then %'what to do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Says 'message' with random pitch, rate, and voice.

custom-block.s: speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br when finished do %cmdRing with the message %br wait %b before doing the next command

block-definition.comment: Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.
Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

block-definition.s: speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl when finished do %'what to do when finished' with the message $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voices'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. And a script to run when finished, This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.
Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Can be the language name in English or itself. Or the official code for the language such as fr-FR for French in France. Also used as the default language for the word embedding blocks.

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

block-definition.s: Open this in a new tab
